page.title: 06Life in Southwick.
page.content: There is little employment locally and villagers commute to Trowbridge, Bath and other towns. Most clubs meet in the the village hall. Charges range from 90p/hour to Â£65/day. Monthly meetings are held by the Young Wives, Womens Institute, Parish Council and Radio Amateurs. Senior citizens meet fortnightly. Weekly events include playgroups, whist drives, discos, bingo and badminton. Scouts, Cubs, Guides and Brownies meet in the old school. There is no British Legion. Villagers travel to Trowbridge to see the doctor and to obtain medicines from the chemists, one of whom has a home delivery service for the elderly. A baby clinic is held weekly in the village hall. District nurses and home helps supply the home care services and meals on wheels are available. There is no resident policeman.
